headline: No-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies
description: These no-bake peanut butter cookies combine peanut butter and oats with no eggs for a flavor-packed cookie easy to make on the stovetop in 10 minutes.

video.description: These no-bake cookies are the perfect dessert for when you're craving something sweet, but you're short on time. Try this mouthwatering recipe for No-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies today!
video.name: How to Make No-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies III

name: No-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar, butter, and milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a rapid boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Mix in oats, stirring until mixture begins to cool. (Transfer mixture to a large bowl if ingredients overflow.)
Drop batter by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Let cool until set.

review.reviewBody: Followed instructions but mine are still gooey they are not sitting up. I tried to add more oats and they are sticky. They remind me of really thick oatmeal. Look good but are way to sticky.
Awesome cookies I make em all the time

I could not find my recipe for these so I looked up a few and this is the one I liked. I have made these for 50 years. This recipe is spot on! For everyone saying to sweet ect., it is a no bake and has no flour! They are supposed to be sweet! With all of that being said, I now have a new favorite and that's saying something! Thank you for sharing!
Love them
They are great. The whole family loves them!
The recipe was super easy and rather fun. However I tweaked the recipe slightly by adding a extra 1/2 cup of oat for thickness and consistency.
I agree about 1/2 C less of sugar. Always a family favorite. So easy and fast to make. Ill make them again but with a little less sugar. My family is sweet enough.
Great recipe and easy to make

I halved it, used almond milk, and rolled oats because that's what I have. I also cut the sugar by a 1/2 a cup. They are plenty sweet with less sugar, but mine are sticky. I guess it's the almond milk? I kept them on the wax paper in refrigerator and eat them off the paper. Still took care of my peanut butter craving.
Very easy gluten-free summer ( or anytime) sweet treat!

I pour mine in a 13x9 cake pan. It's easier and clean up"s quicker. My husband LOVES this recipe. It is an easy recipe. I make them all winter. I normally do not need to use the recipe for I have it forever inbeddted to my brain. I have not made them in a few months so I had to get the recipe out

This recipe was fantastic. My family and friends loved it. I didn't have milk and just a small amount of white sugar so I used 1/2 cup sour cream and 1/4 cup water. Also, I used 1 cup brown sugar and about 1 1/4 white. As a side note, these make fantastic dog treats being as how there are many alterations you can make and still have them come out delicious. My dogs loved them!!!

Only reading the recipe list, I just threw everything together in a Pyrex bowl and mixed it really good. Then I read the instructions. Still tasty though üëçnice and crunchy, too lol. I used less sugar and just winged it on the other measurements.

I think I would recommend you add to the instructions that we shouldn't panic if the mixture seems a little loose at first. Because it takes a while for the oats to absorb the liquid. I panicked. And added more oats and didn't need to. They'll probably be edible but just thought I would pass that on. Lol
Definitely my family‚Äôs favorite treat!! This was an awesome recipe and going in my recipe box!!
Absolutely loved it. I did 2 1/2 cup of white sugar and 1/2 cup of brown sugar. Also used vanilla nut flavor they were absolutely the best no bake I have ever made!!
this recipe was made as per instructed and would never set. Was thick and runny. Did not enjoy at all. You ought to buy a thermometer and use it. just below soft ball stage made them better.

Awesome recipe. So easy and delicious. I made them exactly like the recipe said and it worked great. I may just kick them up a notch by adding a little bit of milk or dark chocolate in the little indentation next time.
Awesome
Love it!!!!! Used tablespoons instead of teaspoons.
Sorry - these are tasty but much to greasy & heavy! I followed the recipe exactly, much to my dismay.....what a waste of all that food! Hubby & I ate a few but couldn't eat the rest.
I love these! BUT let me tell you what I did- I cut the PB down to like a 1/2C; and added a bag of butterscotch chips!!! OMG they are sooooo good

Followed the recipe and made a double batch for the camp. Added another cup of oatmeal to the runny batter. Put them out on wax paper and later threw away the wax paper covered in sticky balls of goo! Worthless.
The recipe was very easy.I add a little walnuts,raisins,and pecan to my cookies.

A truly satisfying experience with a no-bake cookie! I made a few modifications...I used only 1 cup of brown sugar for my sweetener and then I used 1 and 1/3 cup peanut butter (it has sugar added). The cookies set quickly and were absolutely & addictingly delicious!
Very tasty and a nice change from the chocolate version. Made as written other than using margarine rather than butter because it was what I had on hand. Definitely will make again!

I followed the recipe but the cookies didn't hold together well. I put them back in the bowl, added an egg and baked it in a pan. I added chocolate chips during the last minute of baking then spread them for icing.
This recipe was easy to use. The cookies turned out great
This was so easy and tastes fantastic. I boiled about 1 & 1/2 minutes. I also cut sugar down to 2 1/2 cups. Amazing

I was in the mood for cookies and found this recipe. When I was halfway through, I realized that I only had 3 min steel cut oats, which to me is totally different. So the oats are pretty tough, my fault. They set up pretty good and taste like peanut butter fudge. I'm happy with them and will try again with the correct oats in the future.
Best no bake peanut butter cookies I had in a long time. It was fast and easy to make.
These cookies are delicious.
I made the recipe verbatim and for some reason the cookies won‚Äôt set and they turn out gooey I don‚Äôt know why.
i think 2 cups of sugar would do it. 3 cups is wayyyy to much!!! But they are pretty good.
These cookies are delicious. Very quick and easy to make. As some others suggested, I cut the sugar to 2 cups. I also spread them in a 9 x 13 pan for bar cookies instead of making drop cookies.
Easy, quickly comes together, fast snack when craving something sweet.

I took the advice of other reviewers and decreased the sugar by one half cup. The mixture seemed a little soupy so I added extra oatmeal. Turns out I didn‚Äôt need it. They firmed up fine once they cooled and the extra oatmeal just made them dry and crumbly. I am going to try using crunchy peanut butter next time to maybe add a little extra crunch and peanutty flavor.
Just like the ones I get from my local bakery!
Delicious! Melt in your mouth... They didn‚Äôt even last a two days at our house.
So good. I add 1/4 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder
Perfect exactly as written!
Delicious and perfect!
Way to sweet. I even left 1/2 a cup of sugar out and I wish I would have went with 1 cup.
Tastes like fudge! Love it

These are awesome cookies. A tad on the sweet side but delicious, all the same. I used Peter Pan Whipped peanut butter. My son helped me make them. It is an easy dessert that your children or grandchildren can help you make. Great way to make a special memory and learning experience.
Made and they did not harden. Very disappointed!
Family loved them. Definitely Will make theM again.
great recipe proportions are flexible so I like to add a little more peanut butter but you can do whatever you want :)

These cookies are awesome and fast to make. I've made them several times. Tonight I only had two cups of oatmeal so I toasted and chopped some walnuts to make up the extra cup. They turned out just fine so I'll make that a permanent substitution.
I used cane sugar and also added in some honey.
Made the same.Came out great.I will make these again.
No I didn't make any changes to it. Yes I will make it again
they are great

Not a fan, the peanutbutter flavor just wasn't there. i did reduce the sugar to 2 cups and they were plenty sweet, although soft. If reducing the sugar, I would use a candy thermometer to make sure the syrup is at the soft ball stage before adding the other ingredients.
Loved them:)
Love it just as it is

I've just put these on the parchment paper so I cant comment on how they'll set up but from licking the spoon after, (yeah, I did that) I can tell they are super sweet. I'll probably do less sugar next time. Thanks!
Followed recipe exactly. Cookies turned out great! Not too sweet. Made 58 cookies.

I fixed these cookies and they are fantastic!!!!! Easy to make and so much better than chocolate no bakes. I, like others who's reviews I read before fixing them for the first time, only used 2C of sugar and they were plenty sweet. I did not use the quick oats either, I used regular old fashioned oats and they were very good. I didn't drop on paper either, I greased a 9x13" pan and pressed into pan ever so gently as not to compact them too tightly. Do yourself a favor and make these, you'll never fix chocolate no bakes again!!!!!!! Thank you for sharing the recipe :)
very good. the whole family loved these cookies
it turned out exactly like i expected it to. i definitely will make these again.
They turned out great! The key is to boil just right and not to much. I like to add the peanut butter first, to get it melted and mixed in. Then the oats.
The cookies were very good just to sweet. I would make again but would not add as much sugar. I would reduce the sugar by half.
I followed the recipe it was good I will try to make it again
A great cookie for peanut butter lovers like my son. However, if I make them again, I‚Äôll use less sugar.

I agree these are sweet but I love them that way !! They were easy and quick and I‚Äôd make them again in a heartbeat!! Everyone I shared with (which wasn‚Äôt many) loved them too! Thank you for sharing your recipe!!

I knew I was going to be in trouble when I started to eat this out of the pot before it hit the wax paper. I only made half a batch, thank goodness because I almost ate the whole batch myself. These are so very good. I followed the recipe and it was perfect. These will be made again but, not for awhile, I hope. :)
Exactly as I expected! They're fast and easy to make, and they're yummy! Great option when it's too hot to turn on the oven. Also like having a wheat free cookie.
Awesome everyone loved them

Yes i made it and the cookies turned out phenomenal!!! 
Love the recipe thanks for sharing. 
The one thing i did do was use the same ingredients but made hay stacks as well so instead of oats i used 2 bags of dried chow main noodles fricken awesome!
They were good tasting cookies, however there is way too much sugar. I used 1.5 cups of sugar.

Just made this recipe version first time and after 55 years of making different recipes of them‚Äîthese are the BEST! Only difference-I used Old Fashioned Oats instead of quick cooking because we like the chewiness of the old fashioned oats better. These are a gem from the past!
AWESOME!!!
We used old fashion oats and kept them more of a ball shape.

I made the huge mistake of using Steele cut oats. They turned out horrible. They taste like cardboard and kitty litter. I will make them again with regular old fashioned oats. They turn out great with regular oats.
My fianc√© and I love them. Their the best!!
It's just a snack for myself so I cut all ingredients in thirds. It seemed a bit runny after stirring so I simply added another half cup of oats. Fast yummy recipe and they came out great!
Good Just The Way It Is...
Very good! Especially without the cocoa.
1 1/2 cups white and brown sugar
I cut the sugar down to 2 1/2 cups... I also added chocolate chips when mixing with peanut butter and oatmeal! Delicious!
My kids loved these. Super easy to make. And super fun with the kids
Sugar was fine, i added vanilla.
They were fast n easy to make n better than wat I buy at the store

Unfortunately, I didn't have the traditional ingredients to make this properly. I used brown sugar instead of white, and Chinese peanut butter. The sweetness wasn't there, and I could barely taste the peanut butter. Oh well, I'll try this recipe again when I have the proper ingredients.
Holy Moley!!!! These are WAY too sweet
Super easy to make. Thank you for the recipe.
These are very good. I took the others advice and cut the sugar down to 2.5 cups. I hard boiled them for 1 minute only. And they set up perfectly. Will make again.
I made these using sunbutter in place of peanut butter due to peanut allergy. They turned out wonderful! I‚Äôm so happy to have this recipe. Thank you
I recently made a double batch of these, it was delicious!
Love these cookies, definitely only needs 2 cups of sugar.
Easy, delicious and makes a TON of cookies! I halved the recipe and ended up with 20 large cookies. I added 1 tbsp of baking cocoa powder as well, adds a nice flavor.
Love this recipe! Added 3 scoops of protein powder and came out with 7g protein cookies
I didnt have any milk on hand, so I used plain Yogurt instead, along with 2 tbsp less butter, and they came out Amazing - Great recipe, thank you!!!
Just awful. Followed instructions exactly used a timer but just was a sugary mess of crumbly junk. HUGE waste of ingredients
Delicious and so easy!
Did what receipt said and I'll for sure be making them again soon.
I just made half of ingredients

I exchanged 1/2 cup of oats for cocoa puffs cereal the first time and they were a big hit. The second time i did the same thing but then threw in a handful of marshmellows; my boys are calling peanut butter smores and they are delicious
